programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Get started with the basics for traditional quilting. What could be more basic than quilting for home decor and apparel? Rebecca Kemp Brent has a demonstration on free motion and guided quilting to hold a kaleidoscope applique in place, plus a short discussion on fusibles and needles. Then, Angela Wolf demonstrates ruching with elastic thread.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: The first episode is all about the trends. Angela Wolf introduces our trendy top, perfect for every occasion, size and style – sew along with eight different lessons this season on a specific element of the top. Then it’s a trending accessory and a cross body bag with Kay Whitt. Finally meet Ebony Love for our first quilt block – stay tuned over the season for five different blocks AND five unique projects utilizing your starter block.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Using colorful fabric, blogger Mandi Ainsworth fashions cabochons to create heirlooms using a new twist on traditional techniques. Mandi makes a bezel with seed beads to create timeless pendants, bracelets and necklaces. Katie shows how to tie knots in leather strips to create a fashion-forward necklace.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Inspiration can come from a style, an artist, or the material itself. Today's artists get their creative jump start from wire. Our feature bead type is lamp work beads and soft glass vs borosilicate. Then, artist Brenda Schweder is back with a Calder inspired modern, wire art necklace. Then, inventor Wyatt White takes wire weaving to a new level making an intricate bangle.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Adding new details keeps things fresh. Christine Drumheller adds texture as she designs with thread using the sewing machine. Amy Tan sprays and spatters paint for special effects. Julie Fei-Fan Balzer wraps it all up with a review of the fresh new techniques featured throughout the series.

programme.title: Make It Artsy
programme.desc: The theme for this episode is traveling back in time, as we are inspired by history. First host Julie Fei Fan Balzer creates a landscape viewed through antique glass. It's a unique perspective fueled by a photo. Then Michael deMeng has a Day of the Dead inspired project using figurines. Last, we join Cat Kerr for a crown reminiscent of medieval times but perfect for your favorite princess today

programme.title: Stunning Stitch Patterns
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: THANK YOU to all of you amazing quilters for supporting this journey and show! Let's take a look back at 2017 and forward to 2018!

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela creates a modern Southwestern-style quilt that's the perfect size to use as a blanket for summer picnics in the park.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Quilting for charity can be one of the most fulfilling things you can do as a quilter.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: All quilters can get stuck in a creative rut, even Angela. This week, she turns to strip piecing and her fun, easy-to-piece chevron pattern to get her quilting mojo back. Plus, she'll show you how to use negative space to bring your quilt to life.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: She's Baaaaaack! Been itchin' for wine + stitchin'? Angela's kicking off a brand new season with a rather "puzzling" episode.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: These monsters just dropped in to say HAPPY BIRTHDAY!

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: This cake's got sole. JJR demonstrates fashion fondant techniques, piped stringwork and tops it off with a custom sugar shoe topper.

programme.title: Mother's Day Gift Box Cake
programme.desc: Yo mama's so sweet...We made a cake for her! Tune in as JJR whips up a gorgeous gift box cake that might make up for all those grey hairs you gave Mom.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Real cake artists paint with buttercream. Replicate the watercolor cake trend with these handy tips from the Man About Cake!

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Get scandalous with naked cakes. JJR bares it all and makes a rustic naked cake with flowers & a pop of pink buttercream filling.

programme.title: Baking & Cooking
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Today we take a very personal approach using our names and monograms. Our first projects are monogram ornaments made from air dry clay. Then make initial letter necklaces for you and your friends. Today's art journal technique is lettering -- learn some tips for simple calligraphy. Finally make an initial bulletin board covered with initials and doodle art.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Travel to the future for new adventures. Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes a metallic robot tray to hold coins and treasures. Then, she creates a mysterious sea creature. Franz Spohn launches aliens into outer space and Jenny makes futuristic sculptures from foam.

programme.title: Drawing & Painting
programme.desc: Learn to draw and paint with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Vanilla & Beyond: Baking With Flavors First
programme.desc: Learn to bake with CraftsyTV

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This practical and cute quilted zipper pouch is one of Angela's favorite projects yet, because it skips the piecing and gets straight to the quilting! In this episode, she shares three quilting designs every quilter should know: ribbon candy, serpentine lines and the paisley feather, while making a small, easy quilting project for beginners that only requires two fat quarters to make!

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: What do you get when you combine a rainbow quilt, a star quilt and a medallion quilt all into one? A fresh episode of "The Midnight Quilt Show," of course! Join Angela as she breaks down Y-seams, quilting with templates and beyond.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela demonstrates the no-waste flying geese method while making a stunning multidimensional quilt for the most "quilt-worthy" person in her life. And she shares her top 3 tips for quilting big quilts on a small machine.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Joshua John Russell creates modern, edible masterpieces with cake, fondant and buttercream.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into current cake decorating trends! In the Man About Cake series, Joshua John Russell delivers incredible tips for creating modern edible masterpieces. Each week, he decorates an original cake, shares his favorite recipes and gives pointers for designing like a pro.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Real cake artists paint with buttercream. Replicate the watercolor cake trend with these handy tips from the Man About Cake!

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Geometric cutout cakes are all the rage. JJR takes on tiled fondant and custom toppers for a modern kids' birthday cake design (sprinkles included).

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into current cake decorating trends! In the Man About Cake series, Joshua John Russell delivers incredible tips for creating modern edible masterpieces. Each week, he decorates an original cake, shares his favorite recipes and gives pointers for designing like a pro.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.sub-title: Ring Stand, Picture Frame, & Cutting Board
programme.desc: George Vondriska shows you how to create a handmade ring stand that's perfect for storing rings next to the sink, on a bedside table, or even in the workshop. Then, George demonstrates how to construct a custom photo frame to hold your favorite memories. Finally, learn to make an attractive cutting board that makes an excellent handmade gift.

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Use shapes in new ways. Modern Quilt Guild marketing director Heather Grant discusses the modern quilt aesthetic and modern quilt designs. Blogger Rossie Hutchinson joins quilter Elizabeth Dackson to talk about improv quilt events. Instructor Rebecca Kemp Brent uses the latest cutting and quilting technology to create a confetti star quilt design.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Don't try this on your turkey! Learn everything you ever wanted to know about basting as Angela tackles a simple four-patch design with complex sashing.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: In this season finale, Angela does a little flower arranging (quilter's style!) to create Monique Jacobs' beautiful Bouquet quilt.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Advanced doesn't' mean difficult, we are just building on what we learned in the past and adding that next step. Joanne Banko starts with lesson two on zippers – choose the right zipper for the right garment. Then, Angela Wolf is in her studio. Learn basic techniques for bound buttonholes and welt pockets to make them perfectly and professionally.
